title: Constructing a Squirrel Pole Trap
brief: Build a pole trap that can catch multiple squirrels using their natural climbing behavior.
steps: Step 1: Select a long pole and place it against a tree in an area with heavy squirrel activity.
Step 2: Install several wire nooses (5-6 cm diameter) along the top and sides of the pole.
Step 3: Position nooses about 2.5 cm off the pole surface.
Step 4: Place top and bottom nooses exactly 45 cm from the ends of the pole.
Step 5: Ensure squirrels cannot get their feet on solid surface or they will chew through wire.
Step 6: Deploy multiple poles in the area to increase catch numbers.
warnings: If squirrels can brace against solid surfaces, they will chew through the wire and escape.
Initial caution period - squirrels will investigate before attempting to use the pole.
Check trap regularly as struggling animals will eventually fall and strangle.
